title: Meters - nonideal - ammeter resistor and battery

content.question: A nonideal ammeter, a resistor, and a battery are connected in a circuit, as shown in the figure. Which of the following claims is correct?

choices.label: Points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> are at the same potential.

Points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> are at the same potential.
The ammeter current is greater than it would be if the ammeter were ideal.
The current in the ammeter is equal to the current in the resistor.

content.answer: The current in the ammeter is equal to the current in the resistor.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
